h3. Summary

When accessing Confluence from a mobile device on iOS 10 and Safari, the application serves up a login screen that is invalid. This is true for all pages, even with anonymous access enabled.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence 5.10.4 (this can also be replicated in previous versions of Confluence such as 5.9.10) 
 # Enable anonymous access
 # Make sure the system add-on called the 'Confluence Mobile Plugin' is enabled
 # Access the Confluence instance using iOS 10 and the vanilla Safari browser that comes included
 # Notice you will get an invalid login prompt asking you to login to Confluence

h3. Expected Results

Confluence mobile should open up Confluence without asking you to log in.
h3. Actual Results

A prompt comes up in Confluence asking all users to log in every few seconds.

 !Login Prompt.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

This prompt only happens in Safari that comes bundled with iOS 10.
Switching to Desktop version does *not* correct the situation in Cloud, and is not a workaround. Nor is disabling Confluence Mobile.
Tested in iOS 9 and it is not a problem there.

h3. Workaround

- Install Google Chrome or Firefox instead on the device and use that.
- Disable Confluence Mobile by disabling the system add-on called the 'Confluence Mobile Plugin' . Please note [CONF-40782|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-40782] - "Disabling the Confluence Mobile Plugin also disables the Workbox - Host Plugin in Confluence 5.9.X" when performing this workaround.
fields.summary: Confluence mobile version serves up login screen even when the anonymous access is enabled

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43749].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There are duplicate constraints in the database for the {{bandana}} table and the {{cwd_membership}} table.

Table Name:  Bandana
Constraint Name: bandana_unique_key
Constraint Type: Unique nonclustered
Columns: BANDANACONTEXT, BANDANAKEY
Issue:  Constraint and index create duplicate index
Note:  This creates a nonclustered index behind the scenes.  It is basically a duplicate of: band_cont_key_idx

Table Name: cwd_membership
Constraint Name(s): cwd_unique_membership & cwd_unique_user_membership
Constraint Type: Unique nonclustered
Columns: child_group_id, child_user_id, parent_id
Issue(s):  Duplicate constraints,  
Note:  The constraints also create nonclustered indexes, which basically create a triplicate index with idx_mem_dir_parent_child

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove one of the following constraints:
constraints - cwd_unique_membership on cwd_membership
bandana_unique_key on BANDANA
fields.summary: Duplicate constraints and indexes in the SQL server database are redundant

Customer is unable to manage stop words in search results of the knowledge base

The workaround suggested is not available for cloud based version due to cloud restrictions.

Allow customer to define which words the search engine will skip.
h3. Workaround

(available for server based version only)
 # Stop Confluence
 # Download <install_directory>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib/lucene-analyzers-common-4.4.0-atlassian-02.jar
 # Open it (the easiest way is to change extension to zip)
 # Find stopwords.txt file according to your language org\apache\lucene\analysis[en,cz,de,fr,es,etc.]\stopwords.txt
 # Add/remove whatever you need and save
 # Rename back to .jar
 # Upload back to confluence install dir, see 2nd line
 # Start Confluence

h3. Problem Definition

Customers utilizing the [Collaborative Editing|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/collaborative-editing-828790374.html] option in their Confluence Cloud Instances find that Draft Changes made to a page are lost if another user editing the page clicks "close" to leave the page and "Discard *all* Changes" when exiting the Editor; this can cause significant loss of work 

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement an option which allows a User to discard the changes that they've made to the draft rather than discarding the entire shared draft or remove the option to discard the shared draft

 * Regularly publish the page so that a version of changes are stored.
 * Set Page Restriction so that only the User has the ability to Edit the Page until changes have been published.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43718].
  {panel}

h5. Summary of suggestion
When a Confluence upgrade requires the Java version to be upgraded as well, there should be a method of checking for timezone changes in the JDK updates. This is because certain timezones are considered obsolete by the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA), which in turn impacts the functionalities in Confluence.

The IANA is the standards group for the protocols and mechanics of the internet. They're the group that defines [HTTP Status Codes|http://www.iana.org/assignments/http-status-codes/http-status-codes.xhtml#http-status-codes-1], your standard [TCP/IP Ports|http://www.iana.org/assignments/service-names-port-numbers/service-names-port-numbers.xhtml], as well as a globally accepted [time zone database|http://www.iana.org/time-zones].

Should IANA change timezones within different Java releases, Confluence should be able to detect this and make the appropriate changes in the database.

h5. Impact of the issue right now
If the Confluence database continues to use an obsolete timezone to store dates in the database, it will result in errors such as the ones below to be thrown:
{code}
2016-09-02 22:41:40,335 WARN [localhost-startStop-1] [confluence.setup.bandana.ConfluenceDaoBandanaPersister] getObjectFromValue Configuration could not be loaded because class could not be found (context: com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.ScheduledJobHistory, key: DEFAULT#CleanTempDirectoryJob).
com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.ConversionException: Cannot parse date 2016-05-25 04:00:00.1 FET
---- Debugging information ----
path                : /list/com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.ScheduledJobHistory/startDate 
required-type       : java.util.Date 
line number         : 3 
class               : java.util.List 
-------------------------------
com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.ConversionException: Cannot parse date 2016-05-25 04:00:00.1 FET
---- Debugging information ----
path                : /list/com.atlassian.confluence.schedule.ScheduledJobHistory/startDate 
required-type       : java.util.Date 
line number         : 3 
class               : java.util.List 
-------------------------------
{code}

This also results in the installation date in the startup logs to appear as such:
{code}--------------------------
Build Information
--------------------------
installationDate = null{code}

And this symptom currently produces a major issue whereby users can't create pages in Confluence [due to the "Create Page" dialog loading indefinitely|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/unable-to-create-pages-the-create-page-popup-loads-forever-after-confluence-upgrade-to-5-x-330793034.html#UnabletoCreatePages(TheCreatePagePopupLoadsForever)AfterConfluenceUpgradeto5.x-Cause2:].

In summary, if Confluence detects an instance to use a timezone that has been considered obsolete by IANA, Confluence should be able to make the appropriate modifications to rectify the issue. This also ensures the impact received by users are kept to a minimal wherever possible.
fields.summary: Have Confluence check for timezone changes in JDK updates and provide an appropriate fix where necessary

By default "Show Changed Content", as described here:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf54/confluence-user-s-guide/managing-changes-and-notifications-and-tasks/subscribing-to-email-notifications-of-updates-to-confluence-content#SubscribingtoEmailNotificationsofUpdatestoConfluenceContent-Showchangedcontent

We have a workaround which involves modifying the database:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-disable-show-changed-content-to-all-users-407725054.html

* This only works for users that have logged in and has manually edit their email preference settings
* This will not work with users that never logged in, or never edit their email preference settings
* Users can turn "Show Changed Content" back to true which may be undesirable in some environments

This request is for the ability for Confluence Administrators to change the default behavior of Show Changed Content from always being true to being able to select true or false

h3. Problem Definition
Previously, every time you edited a page but didn't publish it, Confluence would create a draft of the page that was only visible to you – we call these personal drafts. h3. Summary

In case that Confluence is integrated with external directories, remember-me token should be ignored when users managed in the directories log in Confluence at least.
The root need is that users can still log in after an administrator forces a password change (due to the remember-me token).

h3. Environment
 * Confluence 5.10.4
 * Crowd 2.9.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate Confluence with Crowd
 # Log in Confluence with a user (User A) and then, check "Remember my login on this computer"
 # Restart the browser
 # Access Confluence with the same browser

h3. Expected Results

Confluence should show login page and need User A to input the credentials
h3. Actual Results

User A could log in without any authentication.
h3. Notes
 * The above actual results might cause some troubles in the following scenario{panel}_In case that there are some password leakages, an admin of the external directories wants the users to update their passwords immediately._
 # In the past, User A logged in Confluence with checking "Remember my login on this computer"
 # An admin of Crowd notices that a password of User A was leaked
 # The admin access Crowd, open user setting page of User A and set an attribute called "requiresPasswordChange" as "true" (It would require User A to update the password when the next login.)
 # In spite of the above setting, User A can log in Confluence without updating the password{panel}
* JIRA, Bitbucket Server and Bamboo behave as well at this moment

h3. Workaround

Disabling remember-me token is only the workaround.
fields.summary: When a password in an external directory is reset, Administrators should have an option to invalidate 'remember me' tokens

h3. Summary

When clicking the Create Decision/Product requirements/Meeting notes button while using the Decision/Product Requirements/Meeting notes Blueprint, a duplicate Decision Log/Product requirements/Meeting notes page is created when submitting it. Removing the duplicate page then creating another decision, results in the duplicate page being created again. Leaving the duplicate page and creating another decision does not result in a third page being created.
h3. Environment

Cloud - 1000.260.0 / 1000.444.5
Server - Current
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Using the Decision blueprint as an example. Create a new page using the Decision Blueprint or open an existing space that has a page using this Blueprint
 # Click the Decision Log link in the sidebar menu
 # Click the 'Create decision' button
 # Fill in the required information
 # Submit the decision
 # Publish the decision

h3. Expected Results

The new decision should be added under the decision log parent page
h3. Actual Results

The new decision log is added under the decision log parent page however a duplicate Decision Log page is created and listed as 
'Decision Log (2)'
h3. Notes

Confluence appears to want the new parent page to be the parent page that will be used
h3. Workaround

Moving the existing children to the new parent page, deleting the original parent, and then renaming the new parent page will allow a user to continue to create additional decisions without additional parent pages being created.
Currently the only work around is to leave the duplicate page while decisions are being input

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43561].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Epic Link column in "Insert JIRA Issue/Filter" (a table inserted in a Confluence page) does not have an hyperlink to the corresponding Epic. Additionally, this field in Confluence does not show the name of the Epic (as Jira's equivalent column does), and does not color-code the Epic link.
h3. Environment

This was tested with:
 * Confluence 5.10.0
 * with an Application Link to Jira v7.2.0#72002-sha1:36e1562

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Pre-requisites:
 * Confluence and Jira have an Application Link established and working
 * In Jira there is at least one existing issue (FLP-7, bug1) which is linked to an Epic (e.g. FLP-2 with Epic name "CSP-183740 test") in the same project (FLP)

Steps:
 # Create a new page in Confluence and write a title
 # Insert "JIRA Issue/Filter"
 # Write a filter to grab all the issues from project FLP
 # Open the "Display Options" and edit the columns to be show to be
 ** Key
 ** Summary
 ** Epic Link
 ** Epic Name
 # Click "Insert" and save the Confluence Page... 

Now navigate to Jira and search for issues:
 # Issues > Search For Issues > write a filter for 'project = "FLP"'
 # Configure the Columns of this query to show:
 ** Key
 ** Summary
 ** Epic Link
 ** Epic Name
 # Now observe the generated table and compare it to the one created in Confluence through Jira filter macro.

h3. Expected Results

By comparing both tables, we observe that the columns in Confluence do not match the columns in Jira. There are several issues:
 # The epic link should be a link in Confluence
 # The epic link should also show the name of the Epic, to conform to what is seen in Jira
 # The epic link should also be color coded, as in Jira.

h3. Actual Results
 # The Epic Link is *not a link* in Confluence. The field name implies that it should be a link to the Epic.
 # The Epic Link in Jira shows the Epic name, while in Confluence it shows the Key of the corresponding issue
 # The Epic Link in Confluence is not color coded as it is in Jira.

The screenshot below shows the difference between the same filter configured in Jira and Confluence:
 !epic-link_jira_filter_vs_confluence_macro.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround. The users have to manually lookup for the issue key corresponding to the Epic they are looking for. There is no known way to display the information as neatly as it is in Jira.
fields.summary: Epic Link column in Confluence's "Insert JIRA Issue/Filter" is not displayed properly

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Confluence has the following Column width modes as per this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/confcloud/Tables]
* *Responsive* – The table will expand as you add content, and you can drag to resize the columns. It'll also resize itself to fit the page-viewer's window size (within reason).

  {panel}

h3. Summary
If a Page Property Report is nested within an Expand Macro on a Confluence Page, the Top Row of the Report does not appear to load or sort correctly

h3. Environment
* Confluence 1000.245.0 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start with a JIRA + Confluence Cloud instance.
# In Confluence, create a page with a Page Properties Report macro on it.
# Create another page with the Page Properties macro in it that'll show in the Page Properties Report macro above.
# Insert a table into the Page Properties macro that contains a JIRA Issues Macro that shows a Single JIRA Issue
# View the original page with the Page Properties Report on it.

h3. Expected Results
Page Property Report shows Details of JIRA Issue 
If multiple Pages are included on this Report, Columns can be sorted.

h3. Actual Results
No Errors are generated in the Logs or in the Browser Debug Console.
If a JIRA Issue Macro is used, it will show a Spinner Loading Icon with the message "Getting Issue Details..." 
!PagePropertyReport-inExpand.png|thumbnail! 

If you try to sort by Column by clicking the Column's Title, the sort does not affect the top line
!SortByTitle-Desc.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Even if a JIRA Issue Macro is not a part of the nested Page Property Report, the Columns cannot be sorted. !PagePropertyReport-NoJIRA.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Move the Page Property Report outside of the Expand Macro

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-43530].
  {panel}

Dear Confluence developers,

at our foundation we really like the daily update mail.

Currently this daily update mail provides a link to the changes. But this link only shows the difference to the most recent version. Inconvenience: If a colleague makes major changes to the document, clicks save and then finds (and corrects) a little spelling error, then the link in the daily update mail will only show the change to the spelling error. Hence all other colleagues might miss that there was a major change.

My feature request:
Could you change the daily update mail so that the "changes"-link compares the current version to the version that was current at the end of the previous day?

It's probably a small change with which you could make many customers happy, because there's no longer a risk to miss out on important changes.

Thanks in advance and greetings from Berlin
Dirk
